item.title: High Alchemy Code
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

An overally, alright first script (is it), but it won’t get you far. You have the SRL include, but it does nothing. It would be best for you to remove it so it won’t take up all this loading time. You also, almost, have a completely endless loop (stop it by fredding F1) and you use ClickMouse which is also a bad idea, since it does instant clicks which can get you banned. It would be best for you to familiarize yourself with the SRL include, and then include the following into your script:
[ul][]MultiPlayer
[]Human Mouse Procedures (Clicking, Moving)
[]Use FailSafes
[]Include Antirandoms and antiban procedures.
[]Don’t have endless loops.
[]Banking (to get more items out or to get more runes out if run out)
[*]Non-coordinate clicking[/ul]

Also, what if i was a complete newbie to SCAR? How would i know when to stop this script? If i didn’t, it’ll just be moving my mouse in the set positions you set them as.

Hope you’ve learnt something and hope you’re on your way to improve your script. If, by any chance you’re stuck, feel free to reply to this topic or PM me with your question.

Enjoy!

.Kyle ;:

Thanks gikon , Someone I know was looking for this , ;p .

Well, don’t give it to him/her

item.title: High Alchemy Code
item.dc:creator: @Gikon Gikon
item.description:
@Gikon wrote:

program Alchemy;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
const
_x = 825; //X Cord: High/Low Alchemy Spell
_y = 595; //Y Cord: High/Low Alchemy Spell

_x2 = 835; //X Cord: Item to Alch.
_y2 = 465; //Y Cord: Item to Alch.
begin
repeat
MoveMouseSmoothEx(_x, _y+random(0),8, 9, 10, 9, 8);
Wait(350+random(145));
ClickMouse(_x, _y, true)
Wait(230+random(235));
MoveMouseSmoothEx(_x2, _y2+random(0),8, 9, 10, 9, 8);
Wait(350+random(145));
ClickMouse(_x2, _y2, true)
Wait(1350+random(250));
until(IsFKeyDown(1));
end.

Only Setup: Use color picker to choose Coordinates needed. Only needed once :]

Read full topic
